Mitigation Level.Basic: Logs with timestamps for critical events.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Encrypted logs stored locally.
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Logs are encrypted and securely transmitted to a centralized logging server with automated anomaly detection and alerting system.

Mitigation Level.Basic: Manual separation of roles and responsibilities.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) implementation.
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Multi-signature requirements for critical actions.

Mitigation Level.Basic: Use of username and password for identity verification.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Incorporation of two-factor authentication (2FA): e.g., username and password with OTP (One Time Password) or Biometric verification (e.g., fingerprint or facial recognition).
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Integration of phishing-resistant hardware-based authentication (e.g., security keys) and continuous identity verification mechanisms.

Mitigation Level.Basic: Storing private keys and sensitive information in encrypted form on the device.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Use of software-based secure storage areas within the operating system, like TEE.
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Deployment of hardware-based secure storage on the device (e.g., Strongbox/Secure Enclave) or remote hardware-based solutions (HSM) to securely store and process sensitive information.

Mitigation Level.Basic: Basic DDoS detection and alert system.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Use of rate limiting and simple firewall rules to mitigate DDoS attacks. For instance, limiting each IP address to 3 requests per minute.
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Comprehensive DDoS protection solutions including real-time traffic analysis, automated blackhole routing, advanced WAF, and rate limiting mechanisms with AI-driven anomaly detection.

Mitigation Level.Basic: Manual credential refresh and update are triggered by the Holder and manual revocation processes are initiated by the administrator.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Automated refresh and update mechanisms with periodic checks for validity.
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Implementation of a cryptographic-based revocation list (e.g., accumulators) and continuous validation of credentials.

Mitigation Level.Yes: Credential validation following the best practices that are provided in the relevant standards (e.g., OpenID for Verifiable Credential Presentations)

Mitigation Level.Basic: Credential validation using the app installed on the personal device of verifier.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Credential validation using a trusted device with outdated software.
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Credential validation using a trusted device with an isolated and tamper-proof environment, the latest OS updates and software, and secure boot mechanisms.

Mitigation Level.Yes: Ephemeral credentials with short-lived validity periods.

Mitigation Level.Basic: Local caching with basic security measures.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Secure local caching with encryption.
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Tamper-proof caching with integrity checks and real-time synchronization.

Mitigation Level.Basic: Manual revocation by contacting the Issuer without request authentication (e.g., answering security questions)
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Self-service portal for credential revocation hosted by the Issuer with request authentication using MFA.
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Automated revocation through trusted Wallet instance with both wallet instance and user authentication.

Mitigation Level.Basic: Manual backup of credentials.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Automated encrypted backups.
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Tamper-proof and highly secure backup and recovery solution.

Mitigation Level.Yes: Real-time push notifications via mobile app with a dedicated tab in the app to further check the credential activity.

Mitigation Level.Basic: Official app stores distribution.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Official websites and secure distribution channels.
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Official websites with advance security measures (e.g., Certificate Pinning).

Mitigation Level.Yes: Basic feedback to users without exposing any sensitive information.

Mitigation Level.Basic: Basic training on phishing and social engineering.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Regular training sessions and awareness campaigns.
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Simulated phishing and social engineering attacks.

Mitigation Level.Basic: Restrict access to debug interfaces.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Restrict access to debug interfaces.
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Encrypt debug communications.

Mitigation Level.Basic: TLS without mutual authentication.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Encrypted communication with mutual authentication (e.g., mTLS).
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Encrypted communication with mutual authentication (e.g., mTLS) with certificate pinning.

Mitigation Level.Basic: Implement Wallet Integrity checks with only basic integrity checks.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Implement Wallet Integrity checks with device integrity checks in addition to basic integrity.
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Implement Wallet Integrity checks with application integrity in addition to device integrity and basic integrity checks.

Mitigation Level.Basic: Basic role-based access control (RBAC).
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Fine-grained access control policies.
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Dynamic and adaptive access control.

Mitigation Level.Basic: Username and password-based authentication.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) with SMS-based OTP (One-Time Password). Password complexity requirements and expiration policies.
Mitigation Level.Advanced: MFA with biometric authentication or hardware-based token. Adaptive authentication mechanisms (e.g., risk-based authentication).

Mitigation Level.Basic: Manual validation of entities based on pre-defined criteria.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Automated validation using digital certificates and basic validation protocols (e.g., X.509).
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Advanced validation using PKI (Public Key Infrastructure) and OCSP (Online Certificate Status Protocol) or OpenID Federation.

Mitigation Level.Yes: Request response verification following the best practices (e.g., signature and data format) and the relevant standards.

Mitigation Level.Basic: Basic session tokens with time-based expiration.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Session tokens bound to user-specific attributes (e.g., IP address, device ID).
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Session tokens with cryptographic binding to the user session and device. Implementation of session timeout policies and session revocation mechanisms.

Mitigation Level.Basic: Periodic manual audits of system configurations and activities.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Automated monitoring with basic alerting mechanisms.
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Comprehensive security information and event management (SIEM) with real-time monitoring, automated responses, and regular detailed audits.

Mitigation Level.Basic: Basic privacy measures like minimal data collection and anonymization.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Implementing privacy-enhancing technologies like data masking and pseudonymization.
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Use of advanced techniques such as differential privacy, zero-knowledge proofs, and homomorphic encryption.

Mitigation Level.Basic: Fundamental remote wipe capabilities (Manual remote wipe trigger, basic authentication, data deletion).
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Enhance remote wipe capabilities (Automated triggers, multi-factor authentication, encryption of deleted data, confirmation and logging).
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Comprehensive remote wipe capabilities with advanced security features and automation (Real-time remote wipe, geo-fencing, advanced threat detection, user notifications and recovery options).

Mitigation Level.Basic: Simple string comparison.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Simple string comparison.
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Simple string comparison.

Mitigation Level.Basic: Fundamental auditing measures.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Enhance auditing measures with automated tools and more detailed anomaly detection.
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Comprehensive and continuous auditing measures with advanced analytics and real-time monitoring.

Mitigation Level.Yes: Secure data exchange protocol implementation following the best practices defined in the standards.

Mitigation Level.Basic: Use of standard cryptographic libraries.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Uses cryptographic algorithms certified by recognized standards bodies (e.g., NIST).
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Regularly audits and updates cryptographic implementations to ensure they meet current best practices.

Mitigation Level.Basic: Binding of holder identity to credentials using claim-based binding.
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Binding of holder identity to credentials using biometric-based binding.
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Binding of holder identity to credentials using cryptographic-based binding with proof of possession and with optional proof of association binding.

Mitigation Level.Yes: Implementation of Robust consent mechanism where users must explicitly agree to any data access or transaction.

Mitigation Level.Basic: Implementation of basic data minimization/selective disclosure methods that enable the user to selectively disclose their attributes. (e.g., selectively disclosable consent pages).
Mitigation Level.Intermediate: Implementation of moderate data minimization/selective disclosure methods based on hiding commitment mechanisms (e.g., SD-JWT).
Mitigation Level.Advanced: Implementation of advance selective disclosure methods based on zero-knowledge proofs.

Mitigation Level.Yes: Implementation of data deletion policy based on the eIDAS regulation.
